intro.title: Introduction to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics
intro.description: Welcome to the comprehensive course on Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics! This course provides hands-on experience with humanoid robots (Unitree Go2/G1), sensor systems (RealSense, IMU), and AI platforms (Jetson Orin) through a structured curriculum with 5 modules and a capstone project.

module-1-ros2/basic-nodes.title: Basic ROS 2 Nodes
module-1-ros2/basic-nodes.description: In this section, we'll create our first ROS 2 nodes to understand the basic communication patterns.

module-1-ros2/introduction.title: Introduction to ROS 2 Fundamentals
module-1-ros2/introduction.description: This module introduces the core concepts of ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2), which serves as the foundation for all robotics development in this course. ROS 2 provides the communication framework, tools, and conventions necessary for building complex robotic systems.

module-2-digital-twin/introduction.title: Introduction to Digital Twin Simulation
module-2-digital-twin/introduction.description: This module covers the creation and use of digital twin simulations using Gazebo, which allows us to test and validate our robot systems in a safe, controlled virtual environment before deploying to real hardware.

module-3-isaac-platform/index.title: Module 3: AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac™)
module-3-isaac-platform/index.description: This module covers the NVIDIA Isaac platform for robotics perception and navigation, including Isaac Sim for simulation and synthetic data generation, Isaac ROS for hardware-accelerated perception, and Nav2 for bipedal humanoid path planning.

module-3-isaac-platform/integration.title: Integration: Isaac Platform with ROS 2
module-3-isaac-platform/integration.description: This section covers how to integrate the NVIDIA Isaac platform components with ROS 2 for a complete robotics solution.

module-3-isaac-platform/isaac-ros.title: Isaac ROS: Hardware-Accelerated VSLAM + Navigation
module-3-isaac-platform/isaac-ros.description: Isaac ROS provides a collection of hardware-accelerated perception and navigation packages optimized for NVIDIA Jetson platforms and CUDA-enabled GPUs. These packages enable real-time processing of sensor data for robotics applications.

module-3-isaac-platform/isaac-sim.title: Isaac Sim: Photorealistic Simulation + Synthetic Data
module-3-isaac-platform/isaac-sim.description: NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a robotics simulation application that provides high-fidelity physics simulation and photorealistic rendering. Built on NVIDIA Omniverse, it enables synthetic data generation for training perception and navigation systems.

module-3-isaac-platform/nav2-humanoid.title: Nav2: Bipedal Humanoid Path Planning
module-3-isaac-platform/nav2-humanoid.description: Navigation2 (Nav2) is the ROS 2 Navigation Stack designed for autonomous robot navigation. For humanoid robots, special considerations are needed for bipedal locomotion and stability.

module-4-vla/capstone.title: Capstone: Autonomous Humanoid Integration
module-4-vla/capstone.description: The capstone project integrates all modules into a complete autonomous humanoid robot system capable of voice interaction, navigation, object detection, and manipulation.

module-4-vla/index.title: Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA)
module-4-vla/index.description: This module covers Vision-Language-Action systems that connect perception, language understanding, and robotic action execution. It includes OpenAI Whisper for voice commands, LLM-driven cognitive planning, and integration with ROS 2 actions.

module-4-vla/llm-planning.title: LLM-Driven Cognitive Planning
module-4-vla/llm-planning.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) enable sophisticated cognitive planning by interpreting natural language commands and generating executable action sequences for robots.

module-4-vla/nlp-ros.title: Natural Language to ROS 2 Actions
module-4-vla/nlp-ros.description: This section covers the mapping of natural language commands to ROS 2 services, actions, and topics for robot execution.

module-4-vla/whisper.title: OpenAI Whisper: Voice Command Processing
module-4-vla/whisper.description: OpenAI Whisper is a state-of-the-art speech recognition system that transcribes human voice commands to text with high accuracy. This section covers its integration for robotics applications.
